subject: Network:add link local auto configuration support on ethernet interface.
commitMessage:
Network:add link local auto configuration support on
ethernet interface.

this commit enables runtime link-local address
configuration and supports "yes","no","ipv4","ipv6"
and "fallback" options supported by systemd

Here is commit to add dbus fallback enum
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/25407

Tested by:
configured linkLocalAutoConf to ipv6,ipv4,none,both
and fallback
and verified link local address objects created

Signed-off-by: Ravi Teja <raviteja28031990@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I70c4b3b2502e37478c9cd747bc9eadfca224ff4e

Patch Set 29:

let's wait for the systemd to fix the behavior of linklocaladdressing = fallback.
https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/13316
Removed reviewer Adriana Kobylak.

Patch Set 29:

(1 comment)
Set Work In Progress

This is going to be updated to read the information from the kernel in terms of scope. We shouldn't second guess this info and there is no reason why we couldn't have link scoped addresses with the config option being changed.
i didn't get you,can you please explain?

We don't actually need any of this code because we shouldn't be trying to determine whether an address is link local or not. The kernel tells us this information when we query the address information.
I haven't looked at the config parser, but we should be able to handle a missing / default value. This would be v6 https://systemd.network/systemd.network.html#LinkLocalAddressing=
Yes, it should have been "LinkLocalAddressing"
We should put the #IFDEF check here also, so that user should not be able to set the link local value.
I'd prefer not doing that because the intention of the ifdef is to just alter the default. Not prevent the user from changing it. (I think we are the original users of this define)

The intent of the earlier changes were that link local auto conf address should not be generated if the LINK_LOCAL_AUTOCONFIGURATION is not defined.

In earlier change we don't have the flexibility to enable it again.

Now with this change we are making it configurable.

So you want the flexibility to enable it again.

Seems we need to improve the help string in configure.ac

AC_ARG_ENABLE(
    [link-local-autoconfiguration],
    AS_HELP_STRING([--disable-link-local-autoconfiguration], [Disable link-local IP address autoconfiguration]),
    [],
    [enable_link_local_autoconfiguration="yes"]
)
if test "x$enable_link_local_autoconfiguration" = "xyes"; then
    AC_DEFINE([LINK_LOCAL_AUTOCONFIGURATION], [1], [Enable link-local IP address autoconfiguration])
fi

By reading above I get a feeling that we don't want link-local IP address autoconfiguration.

We probably want to change the configure setting to match the new configuration primitives. More like --with-default-link-local-autoconfiguration={no,v6,v4,yes}. This would still allow for overrides at runtime.
I don't think very many people seriously want to disable v6 link local autoconf anyway because their networks probably depend on it. Unlike with v4 where it goes mostly unused.

I was reading more on the systemd-networkd, Till now if we enable the link-local auto configuration we always get the link local address irrespective of whether the interface having other address or not.

Now I am having the proposal to change the default behavior where link-local address will only exist if the interface is not having any other address configured.

For the same behavior, systemd-networkd has the following values for the  "linkLocalAddresing"
fallback/ipv4-fallback.

we can add the above enum values in the D-bus interface.

William, Do you see any issues here?

I think we can merge this commit and will work on ratan's proposal
what do you say william? do you think some changes needs to be done in this commit?

This is something we could consider since IPv4 users typically don't use the link local v4 address when DHCP is providing one. "fallback" would seem like the most sane default value since that is what other operating systems default to.

Put the deleted ifdef from below around the value of the default linkLocalConf here.

We can decide how to deprecate that later.

William, Should we put the check here, this is the Get part, where we are reading it from the conf file.

suppose LINK_LOCAL_AUTOCONFIGURATION is not defined, so it would not be written in the network file, hence we would not get the linkLocalConf value here.

Ravi: Yeah, that's exactly what I was looking for

Ratan: It will always be populated by this function when the object is first created. So we need to ensure the user sees the value that will be written out to the file. If we have the define here, it will propagate down to the file writer bit but still allow the user to override the default settings.
William, For the same I had given another comment to put this check while writing, I am ok , if we are putting this check here and don't put the check during write.
Ack
we can put the #ifdef LINK_LOCAL_AUTOCONFIGURATION here, before writing it to the network file.

I still don't like preventing a runtime override here.

This also won't compile as-is with LINK_LOCAL_AUTOCONFIGURATION unset

yes.we are not completely preventing runtime override, user can override if LINK_LOCAL_AUTOCONFIGURATION set.
as discussed earlier,The intent of this change is that link local auto conf address should not be generated if the LINK_LOCAL_AUTOCONFIGURATION is not defined.
why this condition is required?

i thought of setting Maxattempts only if fallback is configured.
by default maxattempts value is infinity and it keeps trying to discover dhcp server
so its better to assign a value.
remove this check

I don't think fallback is desirable for most cases, especially the default. If you plug a machine into a dead network and eventually set up a DHCP server it won't just join the network. You will have to intervene to get it to try DHCP again.
